column4: using kubuntu, networkmanager fails to connect to my howe network.
looking at /var/sys/log...
using WPA personal. The password is correct
is there a known bug?
check the bug reports yet?  ive heard of issues with some wirless cards/drivers and some auth methods.
where are the bug reports?
!bugs
I'm using whatever comes with kde by default
just installed network-manager-kde
about network-manager-kde, muon says "his is a dummy transitional package for plasma-widget-networkmanagement. You may safely remove it."
KDE is moving towards Sub-atomic partical names now? ;P
what sort of authencation does the office use? WPA personal also?
nope, WPA enterprise
the support guys told me there was a long-standing bug in WPA personal
the solution was to use WPA enterprise, but I cannot use WPA enterprise at home
you got a low end home router that cant do  it?
alice router WLAN 1421
that name means nothing to me. :)
it worked before
might be the unconventional kernel (ubuntu 12.04 is 3.3.0 I think)
might be worth testing in a 12.10 live cd(beta) to see if it works there.
